addition.493: * Returns a list that applies {@code function} to each element of {@code fromList}. The returned
addition.494: * list is a transformed view of {@code fromList}; changes to {@code fromList} will be reflected
addition.495: * in the returned list and vice versa.
addition.497:
*

Since functions are not reversible, the transform is one-way and new items cannot be stored
addition.498: * in the returned list. The {@code add}, {@code addAll} and {@code set} methods are unsupported
addition.501:
*

The function is applied lazily, invoked when needed. This is necessary for the returned list
addition.502: * to be a view, but it means that the function will be applied many times for bulk operations

addition.504: * function} should be fast. To avoid lazy evaluation when the returned list doesn't need to be a

addition.646: * Returns consecutive {@linkplain List#subList(int, int) sublists} of a list, each of the same
addition.647: * size (the final list may be smaller). For example, partitioning a list containing {@code [a, b,
addition.648: * c, d, e]} with a partition size of 3 yields {@code [[a, b, c], [d, e]]} -- an outer list
addition.649: * containing two inner lists of three and two elements, all in the original order.
addition.651:
*

The outer list is unmodifiable, but reflects the latest state of the source list. The inner
addition.652: * lists are sublist views of the original list, produced on demand using {@link List#subList(int,
addition.653: * int)}, and are subject to all the usual caveats about modification as explained in that API.
addition.656: * @param size the desired size of each sublist (the last may be smaller)
addition.703: * Returns a view of the specified string as an immutable list of {@code Character} values.
addition.754: * Returns a view of the specified {@code CharSequence} as a {@code List<Character>}, viewing
addition.755: * {@code sequence} as a sequence of Unicode code units. The view does not support any
addition.756: * modification operations, but reflects any changes to the underlying character sequence.
addition.758: * @param sequence the character sequence to view as a {@code List} of characters
